A: 1. Grinding stone is an example of _ technology. (a) developed (b) underdeveloped (c) modern
2. Which of these is a developed technology for cooking food? (a) Firewood (b) Electric cooker (c) Coal stove
3. A blender is used for _ processing. (a) food (b) waste (c) metal
4. A mud house is an example of _ accommodation. (a) developed (b) modern (c) underdeveloped
5. Pipe-borne water is a _ source of water. (a) developed (b) natural (c) well
6. An aircraft is an example of _ technology for transportation. (a) underdeveloped (b) developed (c) basic
7. A gong is a form of _ technology for communication. (a) modern (b) underdeveloped (c) digital
8. Which of these is an example of underdeveloped technology for food processing? (a) Blender (b) Grinding stone (c) Food processor
9. Plants are _ things that can grow, move and reproduce. (a) non-living (b) living (c) artificial
10. Plants are sensitive to touch or _. (a) sound (b) darkness (c) sunlight
11. Plants need _ to survive. (a) air (b) fire (c) rocks
12. Plants have the ability to _. (a) fly (b) reproduce (c) speak
13. Plants feed on food substances in the _. (a) air (b) water (c) soil
14. The ability to remove unwanted substances in plants is called _. (a) absorption (b) excretion (c) photosynthesis
15. Light energy is a form of energy that _ places. (a) cools (b) illuminates (c) darkens
16. Green plants use light to make their _. (a) water (b) food (c) air
17. Light travels in a _ line. (a) curved (b) zigzag (c) straight
18. The sun gives us _ energy. (a) sound (b) light (c) heat
19. Any object that gives light is called a SOURCE of _. (a) sound (b) energy (c) light
20. The Sun is a _ source of light. (a) artificial (b) natural (c) man-made
